content.description: A 100 acre woodlot was observed for the last forty years. Five plant species (1 through 5) were surveyed, with the results shown in Table 1.
content.question: Table 1. Data from Forty-Year Survey of Five Plant Species in a Woodlot Year of Survey Species 1 Population Species 2Population Species 3Population Species 4 Population Species 5 Population 1 35 30 23 32 25 20 35 42 20 2 1 40 50 50 2 0 0 Some researchers claim that the decrease in plant species richness of this woodlot is unrelated to human activities over the last forty years. Which of the following would be an appropriate alternative hypothesis?

choices.label: Interspecific competition caused the extinction of species 4 and 5.
The woodlot environment is arid and species 1 and 2 are well-adapted to conserve water.
The woodlot is shaded, with little direct sunlight, and species 3, 4, and 5 are shade-intolerant canopy trees.
During the last few decades, tall buildings have been built around the woodlot, and species 3, 4, and 5 are shade‑intolerant plants

content.answer: During the last few decades, tall buildings have been built around the woodlot, and species 3, 4, and 5 are shade‑intolerant plants

skill.text: 3.B: State the null hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
